text:
Hi y’all,

I’m trying to get the local development going. but in doing so i need to setup the OAuth and specifically the redirect_uri, because i’m working locally, i think i want my redir_uri to be: localhost:3000. But by doing that i can’t seem to install the app in my local environment.

getting this message:
*Couldn’t complete the connection*
The redirect_uri doesn’t match the client registered redirect_uri. Please contact the integrator.

thanks!
Are you looking at just working on a website?
yeah basically we have a website in HubSpot, but no goot structure to work locally, so i’m trying to set that up

Because if that’s the case - you don’t need to setup an application. You just need to use the CLI - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/local-development-cli>

Once you have it installed you just run hs init in your working directory

It’ll then open a page on HubSpot which will ask you to pick the portal, then will display your personal access token which you’ll then need to copy into the terminal/console.

Once that’s done just run

hs fetch / and it’ll pull everything down from the portal (note it’ll override everything in the current directory)
oooh nice, so using the whole setup for an app is not the right way to go
thanks for the quick response, i’m gonna try this out
its super simple - once you’ve got it setup you can just run hs watch and it’ll watch for changes and upload them automatically
